resources.string: Can\'t include your name or email address
Must have at least a symbol and a number
Agree to the Terms of Use and Privacy Policy

Welcome to MealMate! By using this application, you agree to the following terms:

1. Usage of Service:
MealMate provides recipe recommendations, meal tracking, and dietary management tools. You agree to use this service responsibly and not for any unlawful purposes.

2. Account Responsibility:
You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials and any activities under your account.

3. Content Ownership:
All content provided by MealMate is owned by the app developers. You may not copy, modify, or redistribute content without permission.

4. Health Disclaimer:
MealMate provides dietary suggestions and meal plans based on user input but is not a substitute for professional medical advice. Consult a healthcare professional for specific health concerns.

5. Modifications:
We reserve the right to modify these terms at any time. Continued use of the app signifies your acceptance of the updated terms.

MealMate is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy outlines how we collect, use, and protect your information:

1. Data Collection:
We collect personal information (e.g., name, email) and dietary preferences to provide personalized services. We may also collect device information to improve app performance.

2. Data Usage:
Your data is used to enhance your experience, such as generating meal plans and providing tailored recommendations. We will not sell or share your data with third parties without your consent, except as required by law.

3. Security:
We use industry-standard security measures to protect your information. However, no method of electronic transmission is completely secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute data security.

4. Third-Party Services:
MealMate may integrate with third-party services (e.g., payment gateways or analytics tools). These services have their own privacy policies, and we recommend reviewing them.

5. User Rights:
You have the right to access, modify, or delete your personal data. Contact us at support@mealmate.com for requests.

6. Changes to Policy:
We may update this Privacy Policy periodically. Please review it regularly to stay informed.

By using MealMate, you acknowledge that you have read and understood our Privacy Policy.

Tender chicken, sautéed vegetables and noodles in a savory...
Al dente spaghetti, crispy pancetta, and a creamy sauce made with with eggs, Pecorino Romano cheese and black pepper, creating a rich and comforting Italian classic

350g of spaghetti 

200g of guanciale 

4 whole medium eggs 

100g of grated Pecorino Romano 

ground black pepper

Step 1 
Put the guanciale and oil in a large skillet. Sauté over medium heat until the edges of the guanciale pieces are just turning brown, about 2 minutes. Don't let it get too crisp. Set the pan and its contents aside but keep warm. 

Step 2 
Bring 5 quarts (5 liters) of water to a boil in an 8-quart (8-liter) pot over high heat. When the water boils, add 3 tablespoons kosher salt, then add the pasta and cook, stirring occasionally, untilal dente.

Step 3
While the pasta is cooking, break the eggs into a small bowl and add all the cheese and a generous grinding of pepper. Whisk gently until the mixture is smooth.

Step 4 
Drain the pasta (reserving and keeping warm a cup of its water) and put it in the skillet with the guanciale over low heat. Toss quickly to mix well.

Step 5 
Holding the skillet slightly above but not touching the burner, pour the egg and cheese mixture in a stream into the pasta. Now, if you have the skill, toss the pasta with a deft movement of the wrist to blend all the contents of the pan. If you don't, remove the pan from the heat and mix quickly with two wooden spoons. If you have a warm spot, such as a food warmer or even over a pilot light, rest the pan there while you work.

Step 6 
Whatever you do, work fast or the pasta will get cold and the eggs will stay raw and runny. Ideally the heat of the pasta will cook the egg just enough, and the sauce should be creamy. You can mix in a tiny bit of the reserved water to smooth things out, but you probably won't need to.

Step 7 
Transfer to individual heated bowls or plates and serve instantaneously.
